div.documentation: Properties that directly affect the code generated into the JSPs.

a.title: Optional, defaults to 'dd/MM/yyyy'
Optional, no default value available
Optional, no default value available
Optional, defaults to 'xml csv excel pdf'
Optional, defaults to 'HH:mm'
Optional, defaults to 'true'
Optional, defaults to '5'
Optional, defaults to 'true'
Optional, defaults to 'false'
Optional, defaults to 'false'
Optional, defaults to 'true'
Optional, defaults to 'false'
Optional, defaults to 'index.jsp'
Optional, defaults to 'false'

div.documentation: Properties related to the generation of the web-tier part of the manageable entities (also known as the CRUD feature).

a.title: Optional, defaults to '36'
Optional, defaults to 'manageableForm'
Optional, defaults to 'ref_'

div.documentation: Properties related to the configuration of messages and internationalization in general.

a.title: Optional, defaults to 'org.andromda.bpm4struts.errormessages'
Optional, defaults to 'false'
Optional, defaults to 'org.andromda.bpm4struts.successmessages'
Optional, defaults to 'org.andromda.bpm4struts.warningmessages'

div.documentation: Other various properties that couldn't be classified into another category.

a.title: Optional, defaults to 'session'
Optional, no default value available
Optional, defaults to 'false'
Optional, defaults to 'true'
Optional, defaults to 'org.andromda.presentation.bpm4struts'
Optional, defaults to 'form'
Optional, defaults to 'false'
Optional, defaults to 'false'
Optional, defaults to 'UTF-8'
Optional, no default value available
Optional, defaults to '{0}'
Optional, defaults to 'org.andromda.presentation.bpm4struts'
Optional, defaults to 'Decorator'
Optional, no default value available
Optional, defaults to 'UTF-8'

div.documentation: Defines the locations to which output is generated.

a.title: Required
Required
Required
Required
Optional, no default value available
Required
Required
Required
Optional, no default value available

div.documentation: These properties configure the validation of user input as well as the security.

a.title: Optional, defaults to 'true'
Optional, defaults to 'false'
Optional, no default value available
Optional, defaults to 'true'
Optional, defaults to 'org.andromda.presentation.bpm4struts'
Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The location to which Struts actions are generated.

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The location to which Struts action forms are generated.

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The location to which Struts configuration files are generated. These are the files that typically appear in WEB-INF, such as validation-rules.xml and tiles-defs.xml.

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The location to which abstract controllers are generated.

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The location to which the controller implementation classes are generated.

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The location to which message resource bundles are generated.

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: application JSP pages, login pages and stylesheets are outputted here

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The location where to store application server specific configuration, such as users.properties and roles.properties (in case security has been enabled)

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The location where the displaytag table decorators will be generated (if any). Files generated into this outlet will not be overwritten upon regeneration, they are meant to be edited by hand.

a.title: Go to JSP pages namespace element group

td.documentation: By enabling this property the cartridge will make sure JSPs are not accessible directly by the client: only the server can access them this way. It is generally good practice to enable it since only Struts actions are called but for some reason behavior is different on different machines, so we allow this feature to be toggled. Set to true if you want to prevent direct access to pages.

a.title: Go to JSP pages namespace element group

td.documentation: By enabling this property the cartridge will generate a table containing the current set of page-variables, this table (if any) will be shown in the upper part of the JSP page. This feature is particularly useful for debugging purposes or when giving a demonstration or when showing a prototype.

a.title: Go to JSP pages namespace element group

td.documentation: The default date format to use in case it has not been explicitely specified, for event parameters. Take a look here to see how to properly construct date formats.

a.title: Go to JSP pages namespace element group

td.documentation: The default time format to use when it has not been explicitely specified for event parameters. Take a look here to see how to properly construct time formats.

a.title: Go to JSP pages namespace element group

td.documentation: Specifies whether or not date and time formats are to be strictly matched. This property takes either true or false as values. If set to true all dates and times entered by the end-user will fail validation if they do not strictly adhere to their given format. Note that this strictness can always be overriden locally using the @andromda.struts.view.field.format tagged value.

a.title: Go to JSP pages namespace element group

td.documentation: If specified denotes the default length of text input fields, the value specifies the size attribute of the corresponding input or textarea element. Not speciying any valid value will make the cartridge ignore it and resort to the default browser value by not rendering any size attribute.

a.title: Go to JSP pages namespace element group

td.documentation: If specified denotes the default number of rows of textarea elements. Not speciying any valid value will make the cartridge ignore it and resort to the default browser value by not rendering any size attribute.

a.title: Go to JSP pages namespace element group

tr.td: Default value: xml csv excel pdf

td.documentation: The types of files to which a table can be exported.

a.title: Go to JSP pages namespace element group

td.documentation: Whether or not xhtml should be rendered, as opposed to regular HTML.

a.title: Go to JSP pages namespace element group

td.documentation: The name of the JSP that is the welcome file.

a.title: Go to JSP pages namespace element group

td.documentation: An integer denoting the maximum number of breadcrumbs to appear on a page, specify zero to disable breadcrumbs

a.title: Go to JSP pages namespace element group

td.documentation: Denotes whether or not to render online help pages.

a.title: Go to JSP pages namespace element group

td.documentation: Whether or not hints should be rendered in the generated JSP pages.

a.title: Go to JSP pages namespace element group

td.documentation: Whether or not form page variables are copied into page scope.

a.title: Go to Manageable Entities namespace element group

td.documentation: Defines the name of the form that is passed along during application execution when using the pages related to manageable entities.

a.title: Go to Manageable Entities namespace element group

td.documentation: The prefix used for hidden form input fields when pre-filling an entity reference after switching, this property should only be changed if you have form fields whose name could conflict with these extra fields.

a.title: Go to Manageable Entities namespace element group

td.documentation: The maximum number of characters to allow in a managed entity's table (remainder is truncated using an ellipsis).

a.title: Go to Validation and Security namespace element group

td.documentation: The security realm to use when security is enabled.

a.title: Go to Validation and Security namespace element group

td.documentation: Denotes whether or not the client (web browser) should validate user input.

a.title: Go to Validation and Security namespace element group

td.documentation: Denotes whether or not the server should validate user input.

a.title: Go to Validation and Security namespace element group

td.documentation: This property only makes sense when using the clientValidation and/or serverValidation namespace properties, it instructs the cartridge to disable validation for form fields that are hidden from the end-user.

a.title: Go to Validation and Security namespace element group

td.documentation: The package to which the validator (containing extra commons-validator handlers) will be generated.

a.title: Go to Messages and i18n namespace element group

td.documentation: Denotes the way application resource messages ought to be generated. When messages are normalized it means that elements with the same name will reuse the same label, even if they are located in entirely different use-cases or pages. This results in resource bundles that are not only smaller in size but also more straightforward to translate. The downside is that it will be less evident to customize labels for certain fields (which is rarely the case anyway). For backward compatibility reasons this flag is disabled by default.

a.title: Go to Messages and i18n namespace element group

td.documentation: The property used to identify success messages, all messages are stored in the default location for message used with Struts (in session scope, under Globals.MESSAGE_KEY), but this property distinguishes those mesage from the other ones. You would only need to change this value when you have messages already stored with this property and you want to avoid conflicts.

a.title: Go to Messages and i18n namespace element group

td.documentation: The property used to identify warning messages, all messages are stored in the default location for message used with Struts (in session scope, under Globals.MESSAGE_KEY), but this property distinguishes those mesage from the other ones. You would only need to change this value when you have messages already stored with this property and you want to avoid conflicts.

a.title: Go to Messages and i18n namespace element group

td.documentation: The property used to identify error messages, all messages are stored in the default location for message used with Struts (in session scope, under Globals.MESSAGE_KEY), but this property distinguishes those mesage from the other ones. You would only need to change this value when you have messages already stored with this property and you want to avoid conflicts.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The name to use for the virtual host (if one is required). For example application.myserver.com.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Whether or not redirection should occur on all action forwards.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when rendering the action paths in struts-config.xml, use {0} for the package, /${use-case}/${action} is always appended. For use-case "org.andromda.test.My UseCase" the "login" action could be rendered using /abc/{0} which would result in /abc/org/andromda/test/MyUseCase/Login. Make sure to start the prefix using a forward slash character.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation:
The default scope in which the action's form attribute will be placed when the action is executing. Normally it doesn't make sense to change this value from the default, however you may occasionaly need to override this value using the @andromda.struts.action.form.scope for a given action. The possible values are:
none - doesn't set the form attribute in any scope
request - sets the form attribute in the request scope
session - sets the form attribute in the session scope

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The name of the package in which to create the service files, {0} can be used to denote the package in which the service has been modeled.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation:
The pattern to use when calling the backend code for <<Service>> lookups. For calling services you would use following patterns:
Spring: ${application.package}.ServiceLocator.instance().get{1}()
EJB: ${myPackage}.{1}Util.getHome().create()

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Whether or not to generate decorators for all tables.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The string to append to table decorator class names. The base name of the table equals the name of the parameter representing the table in the UML model, with the first character capitalized.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Denotes whether or not to render dummy data in places like controllers.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Used to define the pattern used for retrieving message resource keys from exceptions. This is useful when exceptions are thrown from the business tier and you want to map these to messages in your presentation. Normally you won't need to change this pattern, however you may want to if you want to enable it to handle exceptions you may have no control over (i.e. SQLExceptions). Currently the default pattern supports an exception with an embedded {some.resource.key} type key.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The package to which the exception handler that retrieves exception keys will be generated.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The package to which the custom servlet (extending the default Struts ActionServlet) is generated.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Defines the name of the form that is passed along during application execution. This attribute is passed along in the session (usually, can also be request if actionFormScope has been changed or its corresponding tagged value changed). You'll normally never need to modify this value.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Encoding for generated XML files.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Encoding for the responses sent back by the server (the pages).

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Indicates whether or not to generate id attributes in the elements of the web.xml descriptor. Some application servers such as WebSphere need them, other application servers such as Resin can't handle them.
